website_summaries.verdict: The Siren Edge is a solid trail shoe ready for the trails right out of the box.
pros: The shoe has a firm footbed that provides support and protection from unexpected obstacles on the trails
Upper performs well when exposed to water and moisture and overall, the Siren Edge is fairly lightweight
cons: Sizing is a bit off – runs large

customer_reviews.title: PAIN RELIEF  LIKE NO OTHER !
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes ,,, I'm 58 my feet, hips, back ,, was killing me I have RA , and 2 weeks ago I had shots in my SI joint... took a chance with this style shoes because of the number of 5 star review...WENT to eBay and bought more Merrell shoes ! PS I have wide feet and swelling / edema , 1/2 up did the job with room for socks.... no one has paid me or given me a discount... Ty Tammy
customer_reviews.author: thomas a

customer_reviews.title: They’re totally waterproof yet still breathable and super comfy. The only reason I rated 4/5 stars ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a hiking trip in the PNW, my feet stayed completely dry while my bf complained about having wet socks most of the time. They’re totally waterproof yet still breathable and super comfy. The only reason I rated 4/5 stars is because they are not slip resistant whatsoever... which I thought was kind of important when dealing with wet surfaces. But I’ve had them for about 6 months now and they’re holding up great!
customer_reviews.author: dannel

customer_reviews.title: My favorite hiking shoe
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite of the hiking shoes I've ever bought. They are not as bulky and outdoorsy looking as the others - they are't brown. They look more like a performance shoe and they worked out very well on a steep hike over rocks. They gripped very well and are very comfortable!
customer_reviews.author: Lee Mae

customer_reviews.title: Very Slippery
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are very comfortable. I bought these to wear in China knowing I would be doing a lot of walking and climbing(Great Wall, rice patties, etc). I love my Merrell Sandals they are amazing. A warning for those that plan to use these for walking, VERY SLIPPERY! No grip at all!! We walked on uneven steps, slate steps very very slippery! I slipped and fell several times. Twisted my ankle so beware. Do not buy these for hiking or walking very dangerous.
customer_reviews.author: katpat

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable and competent trail hikers, but questionable durability over time.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my 16-year old daughter who was getting ready to work at Falley Scout Reservation for the summer on staff. She came home after four weeks for a 24-hour break and reported that she is loves these trail shoes-- says they are the most comfortable shoes she has ever had. She walks miles all over camp every day on rough trails and gravel road. I'm holding back one star because the hard rubber toe on one shoe came unglued and some of the fabric is torn. I know she has been hard on these shoes, but it's only been four weeks!
customer_reviews.author: R. Peat

customer_reviews.title: I love Merrell but these are better than any other of ...
customer_reviews.text: I can't praise these hiking shoes enough! I love Merrell but these are better than any other of their hiking shoes or boots I have. First of all they are light like a feather, yet sturdy enough to keep your foot stable. They are soft inside and don't bother my toes. And last but not least, they look small and cute. I wear a size 9M and most of the shoes I buy look like big boats on my feet, but not Merrell. Merrell makes boots and shoes that make your feet look small, although they fit right. I would highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: Laz

customer_reviews.title: Wow what happened
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made. Mostly vinal material with a very small amount of mesh. This makes for a hot environment. The soles say Vibram but they are not good quality. Perhaps Vibram makes different grades. They run small & the toe box is not roomy as you'd expect from a hiking shoe. Laces are really cheap & come undone easily. I own three different Merrill shoes that I live & are all perfect fits & comfortable. However the Merrill Siren Edge is by far the worst shoe that Merrill offers. Is Merrill just another company going downhill by cheapening the brand? Save your money . i dont recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Luger

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I am very impressed with these shoes. I have always worn Columbia hiking shoes, and I needed a new pair. I bought a pair of Columbia and this pair of Merrell’s. I tried both on, and these shoes were so much more comfortable! I find they are a little longer than the Columbia size 9, but I like it because my toes cannot slide forward and rub on a descent. Both pairs of shoes are nice and wide (I have wide feet) and do not rub anywhere on my foot. Needless to say...I returned the Columbia shoes and kept these.
customer_reviews.author: A. Hastings

customer_reviews.title: Fits Nice, But...
customer_reviews.text: So, three weeks later, the outside of the right shoe is beginning to tear... :( I expected these shoes to have lasted longer, considering they're Merrell. Original Review: Fits as expected but the color was a little lighter than expected.
customer_reviews.author: ThunderRose

customer_reviews.title: Construction of shoe is poor.
customer_reviews.text: I wore these shoes to work 3 times before they started to peel away from the sole. So disappointed. Very comfortable but not made well at all.
customer_reviews.author: B. M. Nelson

customer_reviews.title: VERY POOR QUALITY !!!
customer_reviews.text: MERRELL has amazing designers!!! They are true aesthetes. It is unfortunate that they do not honor such good designs with equal quality. I have used this pair in urban areas and didn't get them wet!!! The upper part of both came unglued from the sole!!! And they just couldn't be put together again!!'
customer_reviews.author: Poly Meros

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware
customer_reviews.text: I received these on March 26 . I have done mostly street walking in them since I received them. I wear an 8 or 81/2. I got these in a 81/2. As you can see the dark blue part of the shoes is coming off. That’s because it’s more like a sticker then rubber. I’m very disappointed. It’s only been two weeks and this part of the shoe is rubbing off. It leads me to believe that perhaps these are not the really thing. Had this not happened I would have given it 5 stars.i wonder if they are really waterproof. Buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: NYC Mima

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful shoes, great fit for "difficult to fit" feet.
customer_reviews.text: Love this shoe (I am wearing them now, I thought they'd looked "ok" in photo, but somehow in person they quickly became my favorites. I am a huge fan of lightweight shoes that I can hike in, and these are nice, lightweight but supportive shoes. They are a bit flatter than I am used to but after I did get used to them I found I don't even need to wear the orthopedics that I have worn in ALL shoes for the past years (due to plantar fascitis) odd though that is. They seem to somehow hold your foot in a more natural position than most shoes or something, I am not sure just glad I found em.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kromrie

customer_reviews.title: super comfortable, flexible, and light with great traction
customer_reviews.text: very comfortable, light weight yet rugged. The bottoms have great traction and grip, did some really rocky, steep hiking and they handled it with ease. I had another pair of Merrell's and the stitching and reinforced toe surround piece dug into the top of my foot when walking. These have a reinforced area but its very flexible and doesn't dig in. there is a nice cushioned insert with arch support. Also the toe area was not wide, but allowed flexibility for the toes, isn't tight or loose for my foot. I would say my feet are not wide, nor narrow. A narrow foot might end up with too much room at the toe.
customer_reviews.author: P. Z Cali

customer_reviews.title: VERY DISAPPOINTED and BAD QUALITY!
customer_reviews.text: VERY DISAPPOINTED and BAD QUALITY! I purchased these in the middle of may (so 4 months) and they have not held up. All the designs on them are cracked and peeling, the seams of the shoe by the soles is separating and the comfort has dissipated. I have hear great things about Merrell and for as much as I paid for this shoe it is not worth the money I have had better luck with Saucony.
customer_reviews.author: PA street and mud

customer_reviews.title: unique fit. true to size but fit almost like glove or slight compression sock. Not tight just fitted to your foot.
customer_reviews.text: Love these! I have a very week ankle and any walking is painful. Orthopedic shoes that are supposed to help my fallen arch are usually too painful to wear. My most comfortable shoes are actually a high top boot. But with summer here, my hiking boots are a little heavy and awkward looking. I saw these online, they were Merrill’s which I knew I MIGHT HAVE A CHANCE WITH. These also came in my exact size, 10 1/2 which is very difficult to find. SCORE! These are exactly what I was looking for, lightweight, lots of arch support, comfortable out of the box. Truly a game changer for me.
customer_reviews.author: Quilter

customer_reviews.title: Fell apart after the first hike
customer_reviews.text: After the first hike, they squeaked and some of the decorative pieces along the sides started to peel off. Contacted Merrell customer support for the squeaking and was able to fix that using dryer sheets (put them in between the insole and the bottom of the shoe). Two hikes later and I realized they are not waterproof, more of the decorative stuff came off, and now the shoe is separating from the sole. I really thought maybe this was somehow a knockoff version of Merrell's - definitely expected a lot more from this brand!
customer_reviews.author: SC

customer_reviews.title: A great walking shoe
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes. I purchased them specifically to walk on cobblestone streets in Mexico. I also walk and hike regularly so I use them for that purpose, as well. They are an everyday walking shoe that is supportive and very comfortable. The look, however, is not very attractive as the toe area of the shoe gets indented somehow and stays that way. I remember reading this from another review. It is just a cosmetic thing but it would be great if Merrel would improve this one flaw.
customer_reviews.author: bjbg

customer_reviews.title: Love these Merrells!
customer_reviews.text: I love them! I tried them on in a slightly different style in a store with the hope that these would fit and they did. They're perfect and the color is exactly what I wanted. There is great arch support and a comfortable shoe.
customer_reviews.author: R. Henning

customer_reviews.title: Best hiking shoes I've owned
customer_reviews.text: Best hiking shoes I've owned! Light weight, comfortable fit, don't require any break in at all. I'm wearing them to hike the Canadian Rockies right now. It's been 5 days of extrenuous hiking and my feet doesn't feel any stress. I accidentally stepped in ankle deep water. Just left these on a heater over night and they dried completely without any shrinkage. They didn't feel any different from before soaking. They look good and price is very reasonable too. I'm recommending them to all my friends and family!
customer_reviews.author: xhu

customer_reviews.title: Great Shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good shoe to take with me as my primary shoe when I travel (and I travel a lot). I wanted a waterproof shoe and one I could take Hiking or running all over a European city. The shoes were stiff and needed breaking in. The first day I wore them to work my feet were killing me but the next day they were much better. I am very pleased with my purchase. I already tested them in the PNW rainy spring weather and my feet stayed dry! I might get another pair in another color,
customer_reviews.author: Kinder Teacher

customer_reviews.title: Not Waterproof!
customer_reviews.text: I searched “waterproof sneakers” and this shoe popped up on Amazon; I ordered them for a trip to rainy Oregon. They arrived, I tried them on, they fit nicely. I almost kept them until I realized that, contrary to Amazon’s description, this style is NOT waterproof. Very frustrating! Sent them back and ordered some directly from Merrell, rush shipped to Oregon ...hope Amazon corrects this error!
customer_reviews.author: A. Stein

customer_reviews.title: The shoes are very comfortable out of the box
customer_reviews.text: The shoes are very comfortable out of the box. I bought these to replace my Merrell Moab's which have a wider sole and was a little concerned about stability on uneven ground. I haven't yet been able to hike in these, but on rocky dirt roads they are more stable than I expected. I did order a half size bigger than normal since the Moab's I have were too short for hiking down steep hills. I'm glad I got the half size bigger as this will allow toe room when going down steep inclines. So far I have been extremely satisfied and especially for the price. Merrell's always work well for me.
customer_reviews.author: Pamgranny

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time
customer_reviews.text: Awful!!!! Waste of time!!!!These are obviously knock offs of the worst kind. Wore them two days at work in an office and the rubberized coating on top of shoe scruffed off. Never wore them on a trail just a sidewalk some steps and linoleum floors. Do not buy! Buyer beware!
customer_reviews.author: MistywetwithRainSC

customer_reviews.title: These shoes are really pretty and the color is actually nicer than the photo ...
customer_reviews.text: These shoes are really pretty and the color is actually nicer than the photo shows. I was really hoping this shoe would be the one, as I've always liked Merrell's. It didn't work. The toe box felt a bit small and the heel felt big. No matter how tight I laced the shoe, it slipped on my heel and felt a bit low on the back of my heel. These shoes were really hard on the bottoms of my feet.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Bombard

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable for long wear
customer_reviews.text: Everyone was raving about this brand, second time I’ve tried them and my feet kill. The shoes never seem to break in and get comfortable. I’m on my feet way more than most people everyday and I just ended up in pain for a few weeks trying to wear these. I threw them out. Ended up with much cheaper basic sketchers and those broke in with in a few days. It’s a bummer to pay a lot for something and they just don’t work, I wanted long lasting quality and all I got was very painful swollen sore feet for a few weeks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Wanted to Love but Needed to Size Up
customer_reviews.text: I bought these just before going on a trip because I needed supportive waterproof shoes. To ensure they fit well, I walked around my house and within ten minutes my toes were numb. Ordered my normal size (7), should have listened to everyone who recommended sizing up. If you're going to wear thin socks and have skinny feet, I recommend a half size up, full size possibly for heavier feet and socks. I wouldn't recommend these if you need good arch support, which is the reason I won't be ordering them in a larger size.
customer_reviews.author: Kate87

customer_reviews.title: Comfy, light weight!
customer_reviews.text: Love these shoes! Very very pleased. If you have arch issues you may be disappointed, low arch support, I figured if that bothers me I will get inserts, so far not a problem. The shoes came in a beat up box, shoes looked like the may have been tried on, possibly walked around in a home then sent back. I seriously think they were tossed in a box and never looked at again. Really, it is no different than someone trying shoes on in a store, just expect them to at least give them a look over before sending them out. QUICK shipping too, would definitely order these again.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: Great walking boots, not waterproof though.
customer_reviews.text: These boots are very comfortable right out of the box and look great, they’re also light weight. I did order a half size up based on the reviews and am glad I did since they fit wonderfully! They are not waterproof, contrary to some of the reviews. I walked round for a short while in rain soaked grass and they did soak through. There is no mention of them being waterproof in the product description. Oops! Don’t base your purchase totally on reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Mary D

customer_reviews.title: No complaints!  Just about perfect!!!
customer_reviews.text: These are the best! I am back online looking for other colors. Have had numerous foot surgeries and foot issues. Love the support and balance these provide. Bought for trip to Italy next year and I’m wearing them all the time-meant to just wear them for breaking in period.
customer_reviews.author: PlatinumSuzy

customer_reviews.title: Walked 185 miles in them!
customer_reviews.text: Love these hiking shoes... I never buy shoes online, but took a risk and I am so glad. I just returned from walking the Camino though trickling springs, mushy and muddy forests, dry hot dirt trails, and sandy beaches... they are waterproof, and held up perfectly. They are super comfortable and the liner is very cushy. Unlike my hiking boots, I didn't get a blister, and when I got home, I cleaned them up and they look great. I love them and I'm buying another pair just in case they discontinue making them...
customer_reviews.author: Judith Croteau

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THESE SHOES SO MUCH. I normally wear a 10.5 in running shoes and a 9.5 in dress shoes. These 10s fit me like a glove. I usually wear running sneakers everywhere, but for a trip to DC with my kids I wanted something with more stability. These are heavier than my running shoes but way more supportive. Love them. They are cute too.
customer_reviews.author: Karmike

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes for those with foot problems.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve learned that I buy shoes too small so I bought these a half size bigger. Super comfortable since day one. We go hiking at least once a week and I have never gotten blisters from these shoes. I had the plantar fasciitis surgery on both feet two years ago but still have foot pain. With these I can go without inserts and experience little foot pain. I do need the inserts if it’s going to be several hours on my feet. I highly recommend these shoes. I used the prime wardrobe when purchasing new hiking/walking shoes. I tried another pair of Merrels along with a pair of New Balamce. These won out of the three.
customer_reviews.author: MRW

customer_reviews.title: Dear god I hope they break in
customer_reviews.text: CUTE style, happy to walk the dog in them in the rain. Definitely water proof. However, I wore them in Alaska for a whole day around town in the rain and my whole body died that evening and the next day. From my neck to my feet there was pain. The soles of these shoes are hard as bricks and I don't know if this is something that will break in. I don't know if I will be able to wear them enough o break them in bc the memory is still too painful. Maybe some insoles will do the trick.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Comfort, solid, long day wearing shoes
customer_reviews.text: When I first put them on, they were snug. But after wearing them for a day to break them in, they fit great. I was concerned they would be too small especially on my right foot which is just a tad bit larger than my left. But they ended up forming to my feet giving me great support and zero issues after the first 10 hour day. Great comfort and solid construction. I will definitely recommend to Women who have wide feet enjoy comfortable shoes that can be walked in all day and look good on your feet.
customer_reviews.author: mia prunesti

customer_reviews.title: Toe Box is very small
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a new pair of hiking shoes for my backpacking trips since my columbia ones gave me many blisters and after reading some reviews on this one I thought I'd try them. I normally wear a 7.5 for running shoes and my columbia hiking shoes, and usually have room at the toe. However, when I tried these ones my toes were so crammed at the end that it was difficult to put the shoe on. I normally buy regular sized shoes for width since the toe box is perfect but these shoes are not the same.
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic stability
customer_reviews.text: I love these!!! I've turned from a soloman stedy buyer to Merrill hands down. This shoe is excellent for stability on trails and a fantastic shoe for stability and arch support. The toe box is a wee bit narrow but these need a week to break in before running the trail. Hiking walking at first is great. They're just to I stiff for running the first day out of the box. I wish I could afford more. I am reallybexcited about Merrill footwear these days. Hey Merrill, I'd love to try all your items and give the review they deserve. A loyal Merrill customer!!
customer_reviews.author: Herbaceous1

customer_reviews.title: Good shoe
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a new hiking shoe and took my son's advice to buy a Merrell. Now my only choice was which one! I chose this one because it looks like it has a slim fit and I liked the colors. Well they arrived at my house and...I think I'm in love! They fit really well and are snug in just the right spots. Very light feeling, and cushioned. I took them out on a short 2.5 mile walk around some ponds the other day. Paved, unpaved, and mud. They were really comfortable and have a nice grip. Would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Echo

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe! Perfect for what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: Love this shoe. I was looking for a good winter substitute for my new balance running/walking shoes - something that gave my feet a little protection from the wind and damp of winter but wouldn’t be bulky like a hiking boot. These shoes are perfect. They’re cute, light weight, are not huge and bulky and give great support. I have plantar fasciitis so the support and comfort are important. It took a day or 2 to break them in but I’ve worn them pretty much nonstop since - a good general purpose shoe.
customer_reviews.author: Hasles

customer_reviews.title: Love Them!
customer_reviews.text: Fit is great like all Merrill shoes. These seem to have more arch support than usual which is what I need. They are also stiffer, more support overall than tennis shoes. I use these when I go for daily walks, which consists of hiking trails, and walking on asphalt. The only thing I would like to mention, the soles seem slick especially when walking on wet asphalt. Other than that they are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Uptown J.

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny!! 5 stars!!
customer_reviews.text: My second purchase of this shoe from Amazon and I’m not disappointed! Love it. The toe box is perhaps a tad bit wider than some shoes. I don’t have a wide foot (average width) but arch support, combined with the hint wider toe box make this shoe fabulously comfortable. Not a squishy-walking-on-clouds comfy, but comfy like its support you can count on. My feet never fatigue in this shoe. Excellent shoe for hiking, or shopping. Very durable. They wash up fantastic (washing machine) and my last pair before these are a year old. They still look good and I regularly wash them.
customer_reviews.author: D. Aklestad

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes!!! The color is amazing and they're waterproof but doesn't feel like it. My only concern is that the shoe forces you to put a lot of weight on your heel. I find it sometimes uncomfortable to walk for long periods of time with the weight on my heel. I changed out the inserts and now they're the best!
customer_reviews.author: Evilgoo

customer_reviews.title: Really comfortable shoes, supportive but not stiff
customer_reviews.text: Some of Merrell’s hikers are about as responsive to the movement of a foot as a rectangular hard piece of plastic would be if that was your footbed. Makes the foot not connect with the ground, or rocks, and the foot slips inside those shoes too. Not so these. These shoes hug your feet and let them feel connected to whatever it is you’re walking or hiking on. I didn’t try them wet though so I can’t say much about that. But if you have any issues with your feet and need arch and heel security, these have it, and they do feel so good on.
customer_reviews.author: Hbatch

customer_reviews.title: What's the deal Merrell 2?
customer_reviews.text: I have so many Merrell shoes, sandals, boots.... I have the Merrell Moab hiking boots that I have worn out, I hate to throw them away when they wear out because I can use them for yard work or painting. But these, no matter how I try to wear them, I get hot spots on my foot pads and my toes hurt, inserts didn't help. I LOVE Merrell shoes, but these and another pair I purchased at the same time never have worked out for me, I tried doing yard work in them but they just hurt to much. This will be the same review on the other pair I purchased at the same time. Sad
customer_reviews.author: Jo Lynn Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Slippery
customer_reviews.text: Fit as expected. However, the color in the picture I ordered is a nice golden brown color, but what I received was a really ugly gray color. Not even silver, more like dish water gray. Also, the tread has zero grip whatsoever so they are very slippery in the rain or on a smooth surface. I would've given one star except they fit comfortably and did not need breaking in.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha

customer_reviews.title: Preformed great!!
customer_reviews.text: We just went hiking and I got to fully test these. *They fit great! Moderate arch support, not much padding under the foot though. I'll be getting an insole for next time. *It has great grip!! We went down somw hills with clay/mud and my shoes gripped GREAT while my husband's slipped. *laces stayed tied perfectly. They never came undone. *my feet stayed dry even walking through puddles and wet grass. I would definitely recommend these shoes. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Teysha

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe!
customer_reviews.text: I have a narrow foot and since I wear size 11, finding the perfect fit is a challenge. These shoes were a perfect fit. However, if you have a wide foot these will not fit you. They were comfortable right out of the box and required no break in. Days after they arrived I left for a trip to England that entailed a lot of walking - these were absolutely perfect. Love them!
customer_reviews.author: Katherine S. Rogers

customer_reviews.title: Love these shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I have plantar fasciitis so I have to be very picky about my shoes. These shoes are amaaaaaaazing. I have bought 2 pairs. They last me about 6-8 months, but I'm overweight and wear them all day every day. Great for hiking. Great for walking around town all day. Highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Sierra T.

customer_reviews.title: love this shoe!!!
customer_reviews.text: These Merrill's run about a half size small. I usually wear a 9 to 9 1/2 in a trail shoe, but the 9 was way too small. Went up to the 10 and have no regrets. This is the most comfortable shoe ever.
customer_reviews.author: Michele P.

customer_reviews.title: and just perfect for walks with my dogs in the open space ...
customer_reviews.text: These are a cross between tennis shoes and hiking shoes, and just perfect for walks with my dogs in the open space in the hills near our home. And these shoes are vegan!!
customer_reviews.author: kathleen clayworth

customer_reviews.title: I have long narrow feet and everything but the length in these shoes seems fine. They are comfortable although probably would be more ...
customer_reviews.text: I wonder about the consistency of sizing. I usually wear a 9 or 9.5 and ordered these in a size 10 after reading reviews. Even the 10's are a bit short! I have ordered a 10.5, a full size bigger than normal for me and hope they will fit. I have long narrow feet and everything but the length in these shoes seems fine. They are comfortable although probably would be more so if you replaced the footbed with something more substantial. They do not make my feet look big and are fairly lightweight. More info after I try size 10.5.
customer_reviews.author: Decorator

customer_reviews.title: Great for light/moderate hiking and trail walking
customer_reviews.text: Wore right out of the box on a trip to Yosemite. Did moderate hiking and quite a bit of walking and biking. Comfortable, light. The arch support is a little off for my foot (a little far back) but it never bothered me. After some walking/hiking I noticed my big toes were hitting the front of the shoe a bit, but I never had pain or discomfort. My feet did not hurt at all after wearing these, which rarely happens. Usually I have some bone/joint pain, but not with these. I ordered my usual size. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Vibrant Colors and Instant Comfort!
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy Merrell came out with a shoe that has fun colors! I am a Merrell lover traditionally, but always hoped for a new vibrant color scheme to come out...and here we have it! I've only worn them for two days so far as I'm recovering from ankle ligament reconstruction surgery, but so far, so good. My other Merrells are a 7 1/2 and I ordered the same size in these and they fit the exact same. Toe box has good room and for the two days I've worn them it feels like I've already broken them in. I look forward to testing them out on some hikes soon!
customer_reviews.author: Dawn S.

customer_reviews.title: Great fit and good quality
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes in preparation for an upcoming trip to Scotland and Ireland. I want to be able to wear them while walking and hiking on varied terrain. I tested them out while on a camping trip this past weekend. They are lightweight and very comfortable. The tread on the soles was great when walking on uneven ground. I have wide feet and usually get blisters or sore spots when “breaking in” a new pair of shoes but I wore these all weekend and my feet emerged unscathed. I liked the fit so much I bought a second pair. I only wish I could have gotten the Black/Paradise color when I ordered my second pair. I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: M Clines

customer_reviews.title: Super Comfortable, Inadequate Traction
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fit me very well and are super comfortable. I also like the color and appearance. I ordered them for a trip to Austria and Switzerland, where we planned to hike and mountain bike a lot. Friends who hiked the Camino de Santiago recommended the Merrell brand. My main complaints pertain to traction and sole thickness. When you walk up or down steep slopes, my feet slide a lot, compared to other hikers (and other boots I've worn in the past). They are super light-weight, which I love, but the soles seem a bit too thin and if you are walking over pointy rocks, it can be painful.
customer_reviews.author: AquaJock

customer_reviews.title: Great comfort!
customer_reviews.text: I normally wear a size 8 but based on reviews I was fluctuating between 8 and 8.5. The 8.5 is perfect. With the 8 I was afraid my toes would hurt after downhill hiking. I wore these shoes 5 days in Mammoth on many hikes and they were perfect. No break in period at all. The traction is good. They are light weight so my back didn’t hurt at days end. I’ve had bilateral knee replacements so I need the arch support to take stress off my knees and these were the answer to my prayers. I didn’t get them wet so I cannot confirm if they are waterproof or not. It’s a great shoe that I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: DG

customer_reviews.title: Arch is weird and zero cushion
customer_reviews.text: They are super cute...but....ZERO cushion and barely an arch support. Not enough for me anyway. I will Be putting a food Ed thing in. They scuffed within one swipe of each other. They fit well other than that and they do look cute! I bought because my podiatrist recommended a hiking shoe/boot for my awful plantar fasciitis so...hope these work still.
customer_reviews.author: Erin and Lemon

customer_reviews.title: Nice TOE BOX !!! Room to wiggle my toes I am happy
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous that the toe box would be too tight on my 5th toe .... but suprisingly it is perfect I can wiggle my toes and when walking no pinching! I usually go fir a widd shoe because I hate when I cant move my toes! I also wear the Merrell Moab which i comparable in fit. This shoe has a lower heel than the Moab, more of a sneaker fit. Slimmer looks not as chunky as the Moab. Good grip for walking not for hikes.
customer_reviews.author: BREATH2

customer_reviews.title: Just What My Feet Needed
customer_reviews.text: Let me first say I have bad feet, plantar fasciitis and other issues. I'm on my feet all day and usually wear my good Brooks. After a 2 week vacation and wearing my older Merrell's hiking shoes for sight seeing my feet felt great. So I purchased these for work. Wonderful! Good support, no real breaking in period and they look great, not like a hiking shoe.
customer_reviews.author: K. Stanek

customer_reviews.title: Right purchase for me.
customer_reviews.text: Received these shoes on a Friday, and was hiking in the Rocky mountains in them on Tuesday. They are nice and lightweight, yet offer some support and traction. Personally, I prefer these shoes over the heavy ones I have used in the past. They were comfortable right out of the box. I had ordered one half size larger than normal to allow for socks. Been wearing Merrell barefoot shoes for years, so this brand has been my first choice for quite a while.
customer_reviews.author: Christine L.

customer_reviews.title: Overall happy
customer_reviews.text: These Merrell's have turned out to be great! Right from the start, no breaking them in. I tend to pronate and have an achy hip after a while of walking, but not with this pair. Though I've only used them a few days for medium distance walking, I expect they will do great on my trip to Italy in the near future. Though they fit just right in width, I would have preferred more length. But it wasn't enough to warrant a half size larger. Quite happy with these and do recommend this shoe!
customer_reviews.author: gnadas

customer_reviews.title: Not waterproof.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these because the description said waterproof. These are not waterproof. I was hiking and stepped in mud and I soon felt the wetness in my socks. This was not enough mud that should have caused any issues with a waterproof shoe. The shoes are comfortable if you are going to be somewhere where you never need to worry about water then you will like them. I was looking for a lighter waterproof shoe since the boots I usually wear are bulky when I travel.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 2

customer_reviews.title: Cute shoe for a narrow foot
customer_reviews.text: I bought this shoe for work. I work at a hospital and walk a lot. I have narrow feet with high arches. I have a really difficult time finding comfortable shoes that fit me correctly. These shoes have been great and as an added bonus, they are a cute looking shoe too. They fit me so well that I bought two of them.
customer_reviews.author: H. Wall

customer_reviews.title: Plantar Fasciitis Approved!
customer_reviews.text: I am shocked that thes shoes fit as expected and that they are comfortable. I love Merrell but I have chronic plantar fasciitis and it takes me a while to get accustomed with nearly any shoe. They are snug and I wish they had a wide width but it does accommodate my orthotics.
customer_reviews.author: Lanie

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for some waterproof light hikers for a trip to Ireland. I tried on these and some Keen's. The Keen's actually felt more sturdy and the footbed was a bit more cushioned but they were pretty bulky. I ended up buying these Merrell's and I loved them. While the inside was not quite as cushioned, they are very comfortable for a full day of walking. They look and fit more like an athletic shoe, so they still look great wearing around town with shorts or jeans. As usual with athletic shoes or boots, I went a size up to be able to wear socks. There was no breaking in time, they felt great from the first wearing.
customer_reviews.author: Barb B

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Fir Overpronation
customer_reviews.text: I want to emphasize that I am a severe over pronator. I found it impossible to find shoes to excersize in let alone waterproof ones. Get a half size up them what you wear in day shoes! I’ve sold Merrells for years but never tried a pair on. This is a HUGE discovery for me as my flat feet make impossible to get a great fit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Fan

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: Great hiking shoe for the money. The Vibram sole on this Merrell shoe isn't very chunky but I've been on some slick slopes without losing traction. The mesh upper is lightweight and cool but does allow enough dust to get through that my socks and feet are dirty by the end of the trek. I have a wide foot and this toe box gave me all the room I need. The only negative is the high point of the arch support is a little further back in the shoe than the natural point on my foot but I adapted without pain.
customer_reviews.author: Debby Krohn

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I got these to wear as winter approached because I wanted more traction when walking from parking garage to building for work. These look nice and the toe box is much better than traditional sneakers as there is more room. I was specifically looking for a shoe that had a bigger toe shoe/box area. i have a bunion on one foot and these do not aggravate it at all. I am usually on my feet for 7-8 hours at work and these are comfortable and they do not make my foot look big or clumpy. I wear a size 9 and the 9 in these fit perfect.
customer_reviews.author: D. Col.

customer_reviews.title: Best Hiking Shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these shoes. I have a normal width foot and no over arch or flat foot issues. I prefer hiking shoes that don't have too much of a heel and these were a perfect match. The grip is awesome - I went hiking in the redwoods after rain and never slipped on the steep slippery parts of the trail. The back of the shoe does NOT dig into my ankle on steep climbs, which is also a plus. The soul is not super soft cushioned, but I like it that way.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great shoe for hiking
customer_reviews.text: Great shoe for hiking. The first time I wore them, we hiked 6 miles out west and my feet felt fine. It was hot weather and my foot swelled some and my feet still did not hurt or feel tight. Over the week vacationing, we hiked almost 50 miles and my feet never bothered me. We hiked some rough paths with rocks and I felt balanced and sturdy the entire time. I ordered my regular shoe size and they fit well. These shoes are good quality.
customer_reviews.author: nuts4nd

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: I really love these shoes. My feet are kind of wide and these are perfect. I love that you can get them in half sizes too, it made for an even better fit. I accidentally stepped right into a huge mud puddle on one of my first hikes with them, but they dried right off and still look great. They seem pretty waterproof but I would spray them yourself if you plan to do a lot of wet hiking.
customer_reviews.author: Ashlee

customer_reviews.title: Fit true to size
customer_reviews.text: These hiking shoes are very comfortable. I typically can wear a size 8 to a 8.5 in women's athletic style shoes. I ordered the 8 and they fit great! I have about a thumb's width of space from my big toe to the front of the shoe. The toe box is roomy as well. I like the lightweight feel of the shoe too. This is my first pair of Merrell's and I am very pleased!!
customer_reviews.author: Rocky

customer_reviews.title: Cutest hiking shoe I've ever seen, but sadly not comfortable at all.
customer_reviews.text: Suuuuper cute hiking shoes. I thought I would love them because I've had good luck with a pair or two of Merrell shoes in the past. Sadly something fit weird in this foot bed and I think would've hurt a lot in the course of a lot of walking or hiking. It felt like the arch support was hitting part of my heel. It started to hurt just standing around in my house to test them out.
customer_reviews.author: BethanyFL

customer_reviews.title: Finally a slim, stylish hiking shoe.
customer_reviews.text: I spent A LOT of time trying to find hiking shoes for our trip to Switzerland that weren't clunky. While definitely not as stylish as some of my other sneakers, these are super cute and lightweight for a hiking shoe. They were incredibly comfortable right out of the box. Very happy to have purchased these.
customer_reviews.author: Casey W.

customer_reviews.title: Runs 1/2 a size small
customer_reviews.text: I have read several excellent reviews of this shoe, and when they arrived too small, I tried some on at a sporting goods store to see if the next size up would work before returning/exchanging. Next 1/2 size up was very comfortable, and I can see why it's a top seller, but I also tried on Oboz and loved them, so that is that!
customer_reviews.author: KDHEER

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking shoes!
customer_reviews.text: I wear size 9 in every brand and these fit true-to-size, with about about 1.5 centimeters of wiggle room in the front. This fit very well on my narrow-high arched feet, providing plenty of support and stability. I wore them around the house for a few hours just to test comfort and I can't wait to wear them on my hikes this summer! They are lightweight and did not make my legs tired like some other more hefty hiking boots. These are perfect for summer, early fall, and spring hikes.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I highly recommend if you like Marrells
customer_reviews.text: I have another pair of Merrell's in this style in a half size smaller and this size is just a little bit more comfortable, although the other pair works fine. I put these on when I got them and have worn them practically every day since for a whole day at a time. They are great support for walking. I absolutely love these colors and this style.
customer_reviews.author: AnnLK

customer_reviews.title: I think these will be perfect. Not as stiff as a lot of Keens ...
customer_reviews.text: Just got these in the mail today for a trip to AZ in a few weeks. I think these will be perfect. Not as stiff as a lot of Keens I have bought in the past and very light weight for a hiking shoe. I don't think I would trail run in these. There seems to be some nice cushion in the heel. I am very pleased with the fit. I wear an 10.5 shoe but bought the 11 for some room for a thicker sock. The toe box is nice and wide. I think these will work out great for my trip and in the winter here in MI with some warm socks for knocking around town.
customer_reviews.author: Kerri L.

customer_reviews.title: Great looks .. great price.
customer_reviews.text: In order to get these to fit me, I walked around for a couple hours in them with socks on in the house. After two hours my feet went numb so I took them off. Two days later I put them on with no socks and wore them 8 hours. They're now somewhat broken in, so I'm going to keep them, they just rub a little on my left heel now. They should be broken in the rest of the way soon .. I'm hoping.
customer_reviews.author: Intellighter

customer_reviews.title: My Rheumatoid Arthritis Feet Love These Shoes
customer_reviews.text: I have RA. These shoes fit like a glove out of the box. They even came laced up perfectly and ti d in a loose knot (so I know they were not resold returns). Perfect width in the toe box, arch support, and they look awesome. I wore them for 8 hrs straight the first day I put them on with no soreness. I’m buying a second pair in a different color right now. A++
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: they must've stretched out a bit and now they feel fine. They offer good support and are cushioned to ...
customer_reviews.text: At first the Merrell shoes seemed a bit snug, but after wearing them for a day or so, they must've stretched out a bit and now they feel fine. They offer good support and are cushioned to be very comfortable. I like them a lot! Merrell is a go-to name brand for me.
customer_reviews.author: Louise Kimmich

customer_reviews.title: Mountain Slippers + Support
customer_reviews.text: Very good, lightweight hiking shoe. Waterproof and sleek. I always wear mine with Smartwool socks and together, they keep my feet appropriately warm or cool and always dry and odor free. For the record, my feet don’t sweat but if they did, they’d smell like a nectar of some sort. Maybe honey, maybe mango can’t be sure.
customer_reviews.author: Dreena

customer_reviews.title: Merrell shoes are great walking shoes.
customer_reviews.text: I only buy the Merrell, however, lately their quality seems to have slipped. However, it is better than anything else I have tried that is out on the market today for walking shoes. This style is a bit narrow in the width and not good for really long walks because of this. I have to replace the footpads in the shoe with my own orthotics so I can't speak to how comfortable they really are when walking,
customer_reviews.author: lee

customer_reviews.title: Love the comfort, color was not as shown
customer_reviews.text: Love how comfortable this shoe is - gave it four stars because I thought the shoe would be dark brown and tan judging from the picture on Amazon, but when it arrived it's a yucky gray. The mesh is a grayish -tan color, the vinyl strip around the toe and the side strips are a greenish gray. I'm keeping the shoes because of the comfort, but the color is a disappointment. Not sure how Amazon can fix this, with the differences in color quality between devices.
customer_reviews.author: Irish Girl

customer_reviews.title: My daughter's favorite shoe
customer_reviews.text: My adult daughter says these are her favorite shoes for work in the hospital. (on the feet all day, I guess) She also loves them for hiking. The first pair lasted about 11 months with nearly daily heavy use.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin W

customer_reviews.title: Fits narrow and small
customer_reviews.text: I have been wearing 7.5 medium width for 25 years: stability and motion control running shoes, hiking shoes, hiking boots and dress shoes (flat). I have narrow feet. This is the first shoe model that was too narrow and small. It looks like a running shoe and not a hiking shoe. I’m returning and trying the 8 because I like the style and it is supposed to be waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: Presents Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes
customer_reviews.text: I usually wear size 6 in sneakers, got these size 6 and they fit perfectly. After walking, hiking in some national parks, they are still as good as new. They are light and comfortable to walk the whole day. The design is great, it doesn't look bulky. Also I walk a lot in sand and dirt and they weren't dirty at all.
customer_reviews.author: Lina

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable but slightly disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I have worn Merrells for years now. They have always been comfortable and I can always find my size. This was the first pair I was disappointed in. That is due to the loop that helps you put the shoe on, the first time I tried them they both tore.
customer_reviews.author: Mia

customer_reviews.title: Great hiking shoe. Not all shoes made equal amongst the different colors
customer_reviews.text: This hiking shoe is fantastic. I don't like over the ankle hiking shoes and these are light and fit like athletic shoes. They aren't bulky like most hiking shoes. They have exceptional grip. My only complaint is that they aren't all made equal. I tried these same shoes in two other colors and they did not fit right at all. I tried the black pair and their size 8 was smaller than the turquoise pair I ordered. Then I tried a grey pair and they were wider. I don't get how the same shoe in another color isn't the same shoe at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes but they are super super small
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes but they are super super small. I wear an 8 but ordered a 9 which was way too small. I am getting a 10. These are very narrow for those with super narrow feet. They have a sleek design and fashionable for everyday walking.
customer_reviews.author: Dani W.

customer_reviews.title: NOT WATERPROOF! Not a hiking shoe
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking hiking?,walking shoe. Thought they were somewhat waterproof as a hiking shoe. They are not at all waterproof and just walking through wet grass my feet were soaked and cold. Not for that rainy day trek through city streets. Other than that pretty and comfy. Hope they don’t smell when they dry out. Bought an 11 for socks usually wear a 10. 10.5 would be perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Shoes Wotth the Price
customer_reviews.text: I bought these shoes for a trip to Thailand and Bhutan. I wanted something beautiful and yet durable. These shoes carried me to the Tigers Nest in Bhutan, the extreme trek up the to the Monastery and back, three hours up and three down on rugged terrain. They fit like a glove and I did not slid at all on the slickest parts of the trek. I love them.
customer_reviews.author: MAP

customer_reviews.title: My feet say, “aaahhh”
customer_reviews.text: I can not say enough good things about these shoes. I work on my feet all day in a huge retail store. I’ve got achilles issues, as well as knee issues..not in these shoes!! Years ago a local shoe shop owner suggested to get a pair of Merrell shoes after I asked what he recommended for someone who worked on their feet all day..should have listened then!! They are lightweight and stylish too!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable needs cushioning for the heels
customer_reviews.text: Not comfortable . Very beautiful and has a great design but I experienced pain . I was so surprised because I have slways enjoyed great comfort from Merrell boots/shoes. I have no idea what to think because they look so beautiful but after 1 mile I was in pain.The pain was in my heels. I probably will place an inset to rectify the situation. Overall they are excellent construction but definely not cushioned.
customer_reviews.author: SFPT

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and great fit
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with the fit of these. I have developed some problems with one of my feet in my "golden years" with arthritis and two hammer toes. So, it has been difficult to find comfortable shoes, especially to order them without trying on before. I ordered these just before a trip to Vermont last week, needing a second pair of comfortable walking shoes. They are just right and I was able to wear them all day without discomfort. I may order another pair soon to have another backup pair. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ann Mosblech

customer_reviews.title: Update after nine months
customer_reviews.text: Don’t get me wrong- these shoes are great, and I posted such when I got them in July 2018. And to be fair, I wear them a lot because they are so great and perfect for my work (lots of walking, wet floors/puddles, ladders, etc). But by the end of 2018, the fabric on the sides was already splitting, and the tread is worn half way down. I have bought a new pair, and I’ll switch back and forth between the two to make them last longer. But 6-7 months seems too fast for the shoe to wear down this much. I can’t afford to buy new ones every six months.
customer_reviews.author: Dottie

customer_reviews.title: Narrow toe box
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have fantastic soles, and for that reason I almost kept them - I can see how nice they would be on a slipper surface, but the toe box was so narrow I couldn't wear them. I guess either get a wide width, or possibly size up. Such a bummer, because it's a beautiful shoe that I had hoped could also double as a trail runner.
customer_reviews.author: Just another OC housewife

customer_reviews.title: Great looking shoe but runs small
customer_reviews.text: I just bought these and they look great on! They are light weight, have great tread, perfect insoles and fit well around the ankle, heel and arch. Unfortunately the toe box is small. The top of my toes hit the top and just hit the end of the shoe. I would suggest ordering these a 1/2 size up. I am an eleven in every shoe but needed an 11 1/2 in this shoe. Other than the sizing it is a GREAT shoe.
customer_reviews.author: loriregin

customer_reviews.title: Great quality for a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: I hiked the Grand Canyon in these. I did not slip or slide while hiking. They have a very good grip. I strongly recommend them if you go hiking often. It’s a good investment. I got them for $70 which I think is very reasonable price. The Shoes are well-made.
customer_reviews.author: Juana Miranda

customer_reviews.title: I like these shoes and am on my 3rd pair.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the grey/blue ones some time ago and then went back and bought the tan. Then I found the blue ones here at a much better price and mine were looking a bit shabby after wearing for about 3 years. I like these because they fit well and make my 9 1/2 foot look small. (Okay, smaller.)
customer_reviews.author: Lynn Lindley

product_meta.title: Merrell Women's Siren Edge Hiker
product_meta.description: Long days are the best days when you're on the trail. Keep your feet feeling good in these hikers with mesh lining and fatigue-fighting cushioning.
feature_bullets: Athletically styled hiker featuring seamless upper overlays with color-pop webbing and ghillie laces
Bellows tongue to keep out debris
M-Select FIT.ECO contoured footbed with organic odor control
